original_solution_mapping.L2: So he added 850-300=<<850-300=550>>550 pounds to his deadlift
original_solution_mapping.L4: So he added 550/5=<<550/5=110>>110 pounds per year

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7192.
    Returns: the number of pounds Bobby added per year to his deadlift.
    """
    # L1
    initial_deadlift = 300 # deadlift 300 pounds at 13
    percentage_factor = 2.5 # 250% of his previous deadlift
    increase_amount = 100 # 100 pounds more
    new_deadlift = initial_deadlift * percentage_factor + increase_amount

    # L2
    pounds_added_total = new_deadlift - initial_deadlift

    # L3
    age_later = 18 # When he is 18
    age_earlier = 13 # at 13
    years_passed = age_later - age_earlier

    # L4
    pounds_per_year = pounds_added_total / years_passed

    # FA
    answer = pounds_per_year
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: So he added {new_deadlift}-{initial_deadlift}=<<{new_deadlift}-{initial_deadlift}={pounds_added_total}>>{pounds_added_total} pounds to his deadlift
So he added {pounds_added_total}/{years_passed}=<<{pounds_added_total}/{years_passed}={pounds_per_year}>>{pounds_per_year} pounds per year

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: So he added 1050-300=<<1050-300=750>>750 pounds to his deadlift
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: So he added 750/5=<<750/5=150>>150 pounds per year

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'initial_deadlift' (300) was used instead of 'increase_amount' (100).
